info.description: The Client API provides access to devices and historical data to Belimo Cloud users and applications.
info.title: Belimo Cloud Client API

captchaId.description: Unique identifier for this captcha image.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: *Optional* parameter to filter by device registration state. Must be one of `REGISTERED`, `UNREGISTERED` or `ALL`, where `REGISTERED` will only return devices that have contacted the server at least once, `UNREGISTERED` will only return devices that have never been online and `ALL` will return all devices. Defaults to `ALL`.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: *Optional* parameter to filter by display name or MP serial number. All devices that contain the given string (case insensitive comparison) will be returned. Must not be empty, if defined.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: *Optional* owner of the devices to search, can be an email address, user-ID, group-ID. If no value is provided, all devices that are visible to the current user will be returned, otherwise all devices that are directly or indirectly owned by the specified owner entity. Note that an empty response will result if another owner is specified by a user without elevated privileges or the owner is unknown.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: *Optional* maximum number of records to return. Defaults to 20, maximum is 2000. See <<collection-results>>.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: *Optional* offset of the first record to return (based on the current sort). Defaults to 0. See <<collection-results>>.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: *Optional* name of a field to sort the result after. Possible values are `id`, `productionId`, `displayName`, `serialNumber`, `deviceType`, `owner.displayName`, `dataprofile.displayName`, `software.displayName`, `health.state`, `health.lastSeen`, `projectName`, `addressCity`, `addressCountry`. Defaults to `name`. See <<collection-results>>.

parameters.name: sortDirection
parameters.description: *Optional* sort direction. Default is ASC. See <<collection-results>>.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: *Optional* filter to specify the direction of the returned transfers. Must be one of `INCOMING` (current user is receiver of transfer), `OUTGOING` (current user has initiated transfer) or `ALL`. Defaults to `ALL`.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: *Optional* maximum number of records to return. Defaults to 20, maximum is 2000. See <<collection-results>>.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: *Optional* offset of the first record to return (based on the current sort). Defaults to 0. See <<collection-results>>.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: *Optional* name of a field to sort the result after. Possible values are `id`, `createdAt`. Defaults to `createdAt`. See <<collection-results>>.

parameters.name: sortDirection
parameters.description: *Optional* sort direction. Default is ASC. See <<collection-results>>.

parameters.name: member
parameters.description: *Optional* filter parameter: ID or email of a user who must be member of the returned user groups.

parameters.name: admin
parameters.description: *Optional* filter parameter: ID or email of a user who must be admin of the returned user groups.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: *Optional* filter parameter: any substring of the group's display name (case insensitive).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: *Optional* maximum number of records to return. Defaults to 20, maximum is 2000. See <<collection-results>>.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: *Optional* offset of the first record to return (based on the current sort). Defaults to 0. See <<collection-results>>.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: *Optional* name of a field to sort the result after. Possible values are `id`, `displayName`. Defaults to `name`. See <<collection-results>>.

parameters.name: sortDirection
parameters.description: *Optional* sort direction. Default is ASC. See <<collection-results>>.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: *Optional* parameter to filter by id, email, first name, last name, display name of associated groups and name of associated role (case insensitive infix).

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: *Optional* parameter to filter by email.

parameters.name: firstName
parameters.description: *Optional* parameter to filter by first name (case insensitive prefix).

parameters.name: lastName
parameters.description: *Optional* parameter to filter by last name (case insensitive prefix).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: *Optional* maximum number of records to return. Defaults to 20, maximum is 2000. See <<collection-results>>.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: *Optional* offset of the first record to return (based on the current sort). Defaults to 0. See <<collection-results>>.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: *Optional* name of a field to sort the result after. Possible values are `id`, `firstName`, `lastName`, `email`. Defaults to `lastName`. See <<collection-results>>.

parameters.name: sortDirection
parameters.description: *Optional* sort direction. Default is ASC. See <<collection-results>>.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: *Optional* maximum number of records to return. Defaults to 20, maximum is 2000. See <<collection-results>>.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: *Optional* offset of the first record to return (based on the current sort). Defaults to 0. See <<collection-results>>.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: *Optional* name of a field to sort the result after. Possible values are `name`, `version`. Defaults to `name`. See <<collection-results>>.

parameters.name: sortDirection
parameters.description: *Optional* sort direction. Default is ASC. See <<collection-results>>.

parameters.name: expanded
parameters.description: *Optional* parameter to expand or collapse the returned dataprofile definitions result. `expanded=false` omits the fields `aspects`, `subprofiles`, and `datapoints` from the result `data` as defined in <<get-dataprofile>>. *Default:* `expanded=true` to be backwards compatible. *However the default is set to change in the future and clients are strongly encouraged to implement the new query parameter.*

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: *Optional* owner of the devices to get the overview statistics for. May be an email address, user-ID or group-ID. If no value is provided, all devices that are visible to the current user will be considered, otherwise all devices that are directly or indirectly owned by the specified owner entity. Note that a response with all 0 values will result if another owner is specified by a user without elevated privileges or the owner is unknown.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Valid ID of a specific device.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Valid ID of a specific device.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: *Optional* filter to specify the direction of the returned transfers. Must be one of `INCOMING` (current user is receiver of transfer), `OUTGOING` (current user has initiated transfer) or `ALL`. Defaults to `ALL`.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: *Optional* parameter to filter versions by name (case insensitive infix).

parameters.name: deviceType
parameters.description: *Optional* parameter to filter versions by device type.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: *Optional* maximum number of records to return. Defaults to 20.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: *Optional* offset of the first record to return (based on the current sort). Defaults to 0.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: *Optional* name of a field to sort the result. Not all fields may be supported. Defaults to `name`.

parameters.name: sortDirection
parameters.description: *Optional* sort direction (ASC or DESC). Defaults to ASC.

parameters.name: usergroupId
parameters.description: ID of the requested user group.

parameters.name: usergroupId
parameters.description: ID of the user group to delete.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Valid ID of a user or the special value `me` to get the current user.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Valid ID of a user or the special value `me` to update the current user.

}

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: A token that was previously offered to open a subscription.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Valid ID of a specific device.

parameters.name: at
parameters.description: *Optional* parameter to specify at which time the state should be retrieved. Can be specified as _ISO timestamp_ (e.g. `2015-12-21T02:45:21Z`) or as milliseconds since the epoch (1/1/1970). Defaults to _now_, i.e. current state.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Valid ID of a specific device.

parameters.description: Valid ID of a specific device.

parameters.description: Valid ID of a specific device.

parameters.description: Valid ID of a specific device.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Valid ID of a specific device.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: *Optional* Start of the data range in ISO-8601 format (including boundary). Defaults to the time when the device data context was created.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: *Optional* End time of the data range in ISO-8601 format (excluding boundary). Defaults to the current time. If defined, must be after `to`.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: *Optional* maximum number of records to return. Defaults to 20, maximum is 2000. See <<collection-results>>.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: *Optional* offset of the first record to return (based on the current sort). Defaults to 0. See <<collection-results>>.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: *Optional* name of a field to sort the result after. Possible values are `timestamp`. Defaults to `time`. See <<collection-results>>.

parameters.name: sortDirection
parameters.description: *Optional* sort direction. Default is DESC. See <<collection-results>>.

parameters.name: versionId
parameters.description: Valid ID of a software version.

parameters.name: versionId
parameters.description: Valid ID of a software version.

parameters.name: versionId
parameters.description: Valid ID of a software version.

parameters.name: usergroupId
parameters.description: ID of the user group to rename.

parameters.name: usergroupId
parameters.description: ID of a user group. Only group members or administrators may access the members of a group.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: *Optional* maximum number of records to return. Defaults to 20, maximum is 2000. See <<collection-results>>.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: *Optional* offset of the first record to return (based on the current sort). Defaults to 0. See <<collection-results>>.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: *Optional* name of a field to sort the result after. Possible values are `id`, `firstName`, `lastName`. Defaults to `name`. See <<collection-results>>.

parameters.name: sortDirection
parameters.description: *Optional* sort direction. Default is ASC. See <<collection-results>>.

parameters.name: usergroupId
parameters.description: ID of the group to add a member to. The API user must be administrator of this group.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Valid ID of a user or the special value `me` to update the current user.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: ID of the current user or the special value `me` (refers to current user).

parameters.name: aspectId
parameters.description: Valid ID of a data profile aspect.

parameters.name: aspectVersion
parameters.description:
Existing version of a data profile aspect. +
Using the value `last` retrieves the latest (i.e. newest) version.

parameters.name: datapointId
parameters.description: Valid ID of a datapoint.

parameters.name: datapointVersion
parameters.description:
Existing version of a datapoint. +
Using the value `last` retrieves the latest (i.e. newest) version.

parameters.name: dataprofileId
parameters.description: Valid ID of a data profile.

parameters.name: dataprofileVersion
parameters.description:
Existing version of a data profile. +
Using the value `last` retrieves the latest (i.e. newest) version.

parameters.name: subprofileId
parameters.description: Valid ID of a subprofile.

parameters.name: subprofileVersion
parameters.description:
Existing version of a subprofile. +
Using the value `last` retrieves the latest (i.e. newest) version.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Valid ID of a specific device.

parameters.name: datapointIds
parameters.description: *Optional* A comma-separated list of datapoint IDs to download. Unknown datapoint IDs will be ignored. If not specified, all known datapoints will be downloaded.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: *Optional* Start of the data range in ISO-8601 format (including boundary). Defaults to the time when the device data context was created.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: *Optional* End time of the data range in ISO-8601 format (excluding boundary). Defaults to the current time. If defined, must be after `to`.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Valid ID of a specific device.

parameters.name: datapointIds
parameters.description: *Optional* A comma-separated list of datapoint IDs to download. Unknown datapoint IDs will be ignored. If not specified, all known datapoints will be downloaded.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: *Optional* Start of the data range in ISO-8601 format (including boundary). Defaults to the time when the device data context was created.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: *Optional* End time of the data range in ISO-8601 format (excluding boundary). Defaults to the current time. If defined, must be after `to`.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Valid ID of a specific device.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the network.

parameters.name: host
parameters.description: An identifier for the host that emitted the log. This value is indexed.

parameters.name: env
parameters.description: An arbitrary string denoting the environment the log is originating from (e.g. `production`, `integration`, `test`, `pilot`, `development`). This value is indexed.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The content of the log must adhere the format specified by its type. See <<log-types>> for a list of supported types.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The content type of the body. Must be set to `text/plain`. The encoding may optionally be specified using the `charset` directive. If charset is not specified, utf-8 is assumed.

parameters.name: usergroupId
parameters.description: ID of the group to remove a member from. The API user must be administrator of this group.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: ID of the user to remove from the group.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: ID of the user to promote or demote.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Valid ID of a specific device. This call only works for devices with known dataprofiles.

parameters.name: datapointIds
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of datapoint IDs to fetch the timeseries for. Unknown datapoint IDs will be ignored.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: *Optional* Start of the data range in ISO-8601 format (including boundary). Defaults to the time when the device data context was created.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: *Optional* End time of the data range in ISO-8601 format (excluding boundary). Defaults to the current time. If defined, must be after `to`.

parameters.name: resolution
parameters.description: *Optional* Determines the size of every bucket. Please consult the detailed explanations above. Defaults to `100` (points). Limited to 10'000 points.

parameters.name: aggregation
parameters.description: *Optional* The selector or aggregation function to use for resampling. Defaults to `last`, that picks the last (newest) datapoint within a bucket. See <<resampling-additional-information>> for a list of accepted functions.

parameters.name: usergroupId
parameters.description: ID of the user group.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: ID of the group member to promote or demote.

parameters.name: usergroupId
parameters.description: ID of the user group.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: ID of the group member to assign the user group roles.

parameters.name: usergroupId
parameters.description: ID of the user group.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: ID of the group member to delete user group roles from.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Valid ID of a specific device.

parameters.name: datapointId
parameters.description: ID of the datapoint to get historical data for

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: *Optional* Start of the data range in ISO-8601 format (including boundary). Defaults to the time when the device data context was created.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: *Optional* End time of the data range in ISO-8601 format (excluding boundary). Defaults to the current time. If defined, must be after `to`.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: *Optional* maximum number of records to return. Defaults to 20, maximum is 2000. See <<collection-results>>.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: *Optional* offset of the first record to return (based on the current sort). Defaults to 0. See <<collection-results>>.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: *Optional* name of a field to sort the result after. Possible values are `time`. Defaults to `time`. See <<collection-results>>.

parameters.name: sortDirection
parameters.description: *Optional* sort direction. Default is ASC. See <<collection-results>>.

scopes.public.read: Read only access to all resources (public APIs)
scopes.public.write: Read and write access to all resources (but without account access)
scopes.internal: Access to users data using internal APIs
scopes.account: Complete control over the user account

scopes.public.read: Read only access to all resources (public APIs)
scopes.public.write: Read and write access to all resources (but without account access)
scopes.internal: Access to users data using internal APIs
scopes.account: Complete control over the user account

scopes.public.read: Read only access to all resources (public APIs)
scopes.public.write: Read and write access to all resources (but without account access)
scopes.internal: Access to users data using internal APIs
scopes.account: Complete control over the user account

lastName.description: Present if the result is filtered by the `lastName` query parameter.

firstName.description: Present if the result is filtered by the `firstName` query parameter.

email.description: Present if the result is filtered by the `owner` query parameter.

data.description: List of visible users. May be empty if filter parameters are too restrictive. See <<get-user>> for description of the fields of a single user.

receiver.description: The intended receiver of the transfer. Must be a valid _User ID_, _User Email_ or _Group ID_.

withData.description: *Optional* property specifying whether the transfer of the device(s) should be performed _with data_ or _without data_, i.e. if the receiver should get access to any data collected from the device during the current user's ownership period. Defaults to `false`.

datapoints.description: List of datapoints defined by this subprofile. See <<get-datapoint>> for a description of the fields of the returned datapoint objects.

ref.description: Reference of this subprofile, format is `id/version`.

name.description: Name of this subprofile (human readable, typically follows some naming scheme).

state.description: Current state of the subprofile (`LOCKED`, `UNLOCKED`). A subprofile is `LOCKED` if it is used by a dataprofile that is not `UNPUBLISHED`. If the state of the subprofile is not `LOCKED`, it is `UNLOCKED`.

supportedAspects.description: List of aspects that this subprofile supports. See <<get-aspect>> for a description of the fields of the returned aspect objects.

properties.description: An optionally empty property-map of `(name:String, value:String)` entries, describing additional properties of this subprofile.

datapoints.description: Contains latest known values of all datapoints exposed by device, indexed by datapoint ID and is structured like the following example: { "datapointId.01": { "value": 12.34 },  "datapointID.02": ...  }.

timestamp.description: Time (in ISO 8601 format) in which returned state was valid.

newPassword.description: The user password (in plaintext). Must have a length of 8-20 chars and contain at least one lowercase letter, one uppercase letter and a digit.

newsletter.description: If the e-mail newsletter is enabled.

lastName.description: Last name of user. Max 50 characters.

address2.description: *Optional*. Second address line of user. Max 50 characters.

address1.description: *Optional*. First address line of user. Max 50 characters.

locale.description: Locale of current user, used for i18n and l10n. Format is `lang_country`, where `lang` is a ISO 639 alpha-2 or alpha-3 language code and `country` is a ISO 3166 alpha-2 country code. The country part is optional: e.g. `en_US`, `en`, `de_CH`, `de_DE` or `de`.

firstName.description: First name of user. Max 30 characters.

jobFunction.description: Users job function. One of `[PLANNER, CONSULTANT, BUILDING_OPERATOR, INSTALLER, SYSTEM_INTEGRATOR, HVAC_PM, OEM, OTHER]`.

countryCode.description: The ISO alpha-2 country code of the country the user is located at. This has *no* effect on i18n or l10n, but affects business processes. Max 2 characters.

department.description: *Optional*. Work department of user. Max 50 characters.

api_v3_users_userId1236821942.example:
{
  "locale" : "en_US",
  "firstName" : "Fred",
  "lastName" : "Feuerstein",
  "title" : "Bronto Crane Operator",
  "company" : "Slate Rock and Gravel Company",
  "address1" : "c/o Burney Rubble",
  "address2" : "345 Cave Stone Road",
  "state" : "Rockstate",
  "zip" : "12345",
  "city" : "Bedrock",
  "countryCode" : "US",
  "department" : "Private",
  "jobFunction" : "BUILDING_OPERATOR",
  "phone" : "123456789",
  "newsletter" : true
}

data.description: List of user group members within the requested page.

lastName.description: The last name of the member.

firstName.description: The first name of the member.

currentUser.description: `true` if the member is the user that executed the query. May be used to provide additional warning/confirmation messages for destructive operations.

groupAdmin.description: `true` if the member is a group admin.

permissions.description: A list of permissions of the current user for this member. May be `PROMOTE` that allows the member to become group admin, `DEMOTE` that allows an admin to become ordinary member or `REMOVE` that allows removal of the member from the group.

roles.description: A list of user group roles assigned to the member in the context of this group.

email.description: The e-mail address (login) of the member.

name.description: New name of the software version. Must not be empty. Must be unique.

ref.description: *Optional* The reference (URI-part) to the device entity. Only available if device is known in the cloud.

serialNumber.description: The (MP) serial number of the device.

address.description: The network specific address of the device.

displayName.description: *Optional* The display name of the device in the cloud. Only available if device is known in the cloud.

entityId.description: *Optional* The device ID, if the device is known in the cloud.

properties.description: *Optional* Additional properties of the device as a list of objects with two fields `name` and `value`.

displayName.description: A human-readable name of the network.

name.description: The name of the network (unique per device and may be used as ID)

type.description: The type of the physical network interface. Either `ip` or `mp`.

timestamp.description: The time of the update of the last update of this network in ISO 8601 format.

brokerId.description: Identifier that uniquely identifies the mobile broker instance. Should not change over time, e.g. _Android ID_, _phone number_ or a UUID generated by the mobile broker app upon installation. Maximum length is 100 chars.

name.description: Name of API for which access is requested. Must be set to `device-api`.

version.description: API version implemented by the mobile broker in semantic version format, e.g. `2.0.1`. If no version is specified, then access to the _newest API version_ will be granted.

nfcId.description: NFC-ID of the brokered device as defined in production.

sic.description: SIC of the brokered device, encoded as 32 uppercase hex chars.

timestamp.description: Timestamp of the value in ISO-8601 format. Important: This is the timestamp of the beginning of the data-bucket (and not the timestamp of the actual measurement).

aggregation.description: Aggregation function that was used to resample the series.

datapointId.description: Datapoint ID that identifies the series.

from.description: Start of the interval in ISO-8601 format.

to.description: End of the interval in ISO-8601 format.

resolution.description: The resampling interval of the returned datapoints.

validUntil.description: The point in time until this offer is valid.

token.description: A unique token that can be used to open a subscription.

updatePending.description: If an update is pending or currently in progress (i.e. if update process has started). No other updates can be triggered as long as an installation is pending.

availableUpdate.description: Reference to the software update that is available for installation (if `updatePending` is false) or already pending for installation (if `updatePending` is true).

ref.description: Reference to follow to load complete update information.

displayName.description: Name of the update to display to the user.

softwareUpdateMode.description: Mode how the device handles software updates. For defined values of the mode, see the section <<software-update-mode>>

softwareUpdateSupported.description: Whether the device is able to update its software. If false, the current software of the device is never able to install updates through the cloud.

availableUpdateVersion.description: Reference to the software version the device will reach when it installs the available update.

ref.description: Reference to follow to load complete version information.

displayName.description: Name of the version to display to the user.

currentVersion.description: Reference to the software version the device is currently operating with.

ref.description: Reference to follow to load complete version information.

displayName.description: Name of the version to display to the user.

apiEndpoint.description: Device-API endpoint. This URL must be used as base URL for all subsequent device API requests performed by the mobile broker.

deviceId.description: Unique ID that identifies a device over a period of time. Used to access device-specific API endpoints. May change if the device is transferred to a new owner or due to other lifecycle events. If so, a new temporary access must be requested.

credentials.description: Authentication credentials according to the specified `type`.

validUntil.description: Expiration time of the temporary access credentials as _ISO-Timestamp_.

type.description: Type of authentication credentials. Can be used to construct an `Authorization` HTTP header together with the provided `credentials` value. Currently always `Basic`.

name.description: Present if the result is filtered by the `name` query parameter.

member.description: Present if the result is filtered by the `member` query parameter.

admin.description: Present if the result is filtered by the `admin` query parameter.

data.description: List of user groups within the selected page. May be empty, if filter parameters are too restrictive or if user is not part of any user groups.

permissions.description: A list of permissions of the current user for this group. May be `EDIT` that allows editing group properties, or `DELETE` that allows the deletion of the whole group.

displayName.description: The human readable name of the group.

members.description: The total number of members in the group (administrators and/or members).

administrators.description: The number of administrators in the group (at least 1).

newEmail.description: The new email address. Maximum length 50 chars.

data.description: Result data of the pageable request with device transfer request objects. See <<get-device-transfer>> for a more detailed description of the result object fields.

details.description: Contains an object specific to the type of the event (see below).

type.description: The type of the event. May be one of `METADATA_CHANGE`, `SOFTWARE_CHANGE`, `DATAPROFILE_CHANGE`, `OWNER_CHANGE`, `DEVICE_DATAPOINT_CHANGE`, `CONFIGURATION_CHANGE`.

timestamp.description: The date and time the event occurred (in ISO-8601 format).

datapoints.description: A map of _(datapointId,value)_ entries, where `datapointId` is the ID of a _metadata_ datapoint supported by the global _metadata subprofile_ and `value` is a value that adheres to the datapoint's definition (basetype, format, range, etc).

downloadUrl.description: A temporary URL where the CSV may be downloaded from using a `GET` request. Even though the location may be located within the scope of the client API, there is no authentication necessary.

validUntil.description: A timestamp in ISO8601 format that represents the time after which the download URL will become invalid.

owner.description: Current owner of the device in transfer.

displayName.description: Display name of the current owner.

id.description: ID of the current owner, either a user or group ID.

email.description: *Optional* email of the current owner, if individual. Not defined if current owner is a group.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of the transfer request's creation, as _ISO Date String_.

id.description: ID of the receiver, either a user or group ID.

email.description: *Optional* email of the receiver, if individual. Not defined if receiver is a group.

withData.description: Indicates whether the transfer is performed with or without historical data.

id.description: ID of the transfer, can be used to cancel, accept or delete the transfer request.

serialNumber.description: Serial number of the device being transferred.

displayName.description: Display name of the device being transferred.

id.description: ID of the device being transferred.

roles.description: List of all available roles in the context of user groups: `[DEVICE_ADMIN, DEVICE_MAINTENANCE, DEVICE_GUEST]`.

from.description: The requested start of the data range in ISO-8601 format.

to.description: The requested end of the data range in ISO-8601 format.

timestamp.description: The sample time in ISO-8601 format

state.description: One of `ACCEPTED` or `PENDING`. Indicates whether the transfer has been executed (i.e. accepted) immediately. Normally returns as `PENDING`, unless the current user has special privileges.

transferId.description: ID of the created transfer request which can be used to cancel (i.e. delete) or accept the request.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of the job's creation, as _ISO Datetime String_.

mergeable.description: Indicates whether this job can be merged.

cancelable.description: Indicates whether this job can be canceled.

createdBy.description: Information about the initiator of the job.

ref.description: The reference to the user that created the job.

autoCancelAfter.description: *Optional.* Indicates whether this job will be automatically canceled by the system if it hasn't been executed until the indicated _ISO Datetime String_ timestamp.

state.description: State of the job. Can be one of `PENDING`, `CANCELED`, `EXECUTING`, `SUCCESS`, `FAILURE`.

id.description: ID of the job. Can be used to cancel the job.

networks.description: List of networks of this device. Details may be fetched using the GET networks query.

name.description: The name of the network (unique per device, see section <<get-device-network>>)

type.description: The type of the network (see section <<get-device-network>>)

op.description: The name of the operation. Must be `SWUPDATE`.

serialNumber.description: The serial number of the device to add.

authorizationCode.description: Authorization code (i.e. claiming code), retrieved from the device.

groupId.description: *Optional* An ID of an existing user group if the device should be added to a user group. The current user must be a member of the specified group. If not specified, the device will be added to the current user.

softwareUpdateId.description: The ID if the software update package to install. Only updates that are available for this device can be specified.

deviceId.description: The ID of the device to update.

timestamp.description: *Optional* May be specified to claim the device at a specific point in time. Timestamp is in ISO 8601 format. Must be after the last time the device was claimed/transferred but must not be in the future. If not specified, the device will be claimed for the time of the execution of this request (i.e. 'now').

lastName.description: Last name of user. Max 50 characters.

firstName.description: First name of user. Max 30 characters.

accountActivated.description: True if the account is activated. Non-activated accounts may not access most parts of the API. Clients should present a message to the user, that activation is necessary.

roles.description: List of this user's roles. May be empty or contain any of `[DEVICE_SUPPORT, USER_SUPPORT, DATA_ANALYST, DEVICE_DEVELOPER, CLIENT_DEVELOPER, INTERNAL_DEVELOPER, CLOUD_MANAGER, USER_ADMIN, SW_ADMIN, METERING_COMMISSIONER_ADMIN, ADMIN, BETA_TESTER]`.

locale.description: Locale of current user, used for i18n and l10n. Format is `lang_country`, where `lang` is a ISO 639 alpha-2 or alpha-3 language code and `country` is a ISO 3166 alpha-2 country code. The country part is optional: e.g. `en_US`, `en`, `de_CH`, `de_DE` or `de`.

features.description: List of features that this aspect defines.

optional.description: Defines whether this feature is optional. `true` if this feature may be omitted when defining the properties of a datapoint.

ref.description: Reference of this aspect, format is `id/version`.

name.description: Name of this aspect (human readable, typically follows some naming scheme).

properties.description: An optionally empty property-map of `(name:String, value:String)` entries, describing additional properties of an aspect.

roles.description: List of user group roles to assign to this member. May be empty or contain any of `[DEVICE_ADMIN, DEVICE_MAINTENANCE, DEVICE_GUEST]`.

serialNumber.description: The serial number of the device.

displayName.description: A human readable name of the device (if available).

id.description: The (new) ID of the device that was added to the account.

definedBy.description: ID and version of the subprofile that defines this datapoint, e.g. `mbF3382r/0.4`.

featureValues.description:
Map of this datapoint's aspect feature values (i.e. metadata fields). +
The map's keys correspond to the full name of a supported aspect's feature and have the format `'{aspectId}.{featureName}'`.

expiry.description: *Optional* time when confirmation token expires. The issued confirmation request (e.g. email with confirmation link) must be answered until then or will become invalid otherwise. Only defined, when `confirmed=false`.

confirmed.description: Status of email change confirmation. Default is `false`, indicating that there is a pending confirmation request. Will return with `true` if the new email is equal to the old one or if email does not need confirmation for some reason.

includedDatapointIds.description: A list of IDs of datapoint (e.g. default.0) that should be included in the change stream. All datapoints will be included if this list is left empty.

includedDeviceIds.description: A list of device IDs that should be included in the change stream. All devices will be included if this list is left empty.

newsletter.description: If the e-mail newsletter is enabled.

lastName.description: Last name of user. Max 50 characters.

lastLogin.description: *Optional* The timestamp when the user logged in the last time (ISO 8601 format). Technically, this is equivalent to the time an OAuth token was last requested. May be missing if the user never logged in after creating the account.

roles.description: List of this user's roles. May be empty or contain any of `[DEVICE_SUPPORT, USER_SUPPORT, DATA_ANALYST, DEVICE_DEVELOPER, CLIENT_DEVELOPER, INTERNAL_DEVELOPER, CLOUD_MANAGER, USER_ADMIN, SW_ADMIN, METERING_COMMISSIONER_ADMIN, ADMIN, BETA_TESTER]`.

locale.description: Locale of current user, used for i18n and l10n. Format is `lang_country`, where `lang` is a ISO 639 alpha-2 or alpha-3 language code and `country` is a ISO 3166 alpha-2 country code. The country part is optional: e.g. `en_US`, `en`, `de_CH`, `de_DE` or `de`.

lastUpdated.description: *Optional* The timestamp when the user's database record was last updated (ISO 8601 format).

jobFunction.description: Users job function. One of `[PLANNER, CONSULTANT, BUILDING_OPERATOR, INSTALLER, SYSTEM_INTEGRATOR, HVAC_PM, OEM, OTHER]`.

countryCode.description: The ISO alpha-2 country code of the country the user is located at. This has *no* effect on i18n or l10n, but affects business processes. Max 2 characters.

registrationDate.description: The timestamp when the user was registered (ISO 8601 format).

department.description: *Optional*. Work department of user. Max 50 characters.

address2.description: *Optional*. Second address line of user. Max 50 characters.

address1.description: *Optional*. First address line of user. Max 50 characters.

groups.description: A list of groups the user is member (or administrator) of.

ref.description: The URI-style reference to the entity that may be used to lookup details.

firstName.description: First name of user. Max 30 characters.

accountActivated.description: True if the account is activated. Non-activated accounts may not access most parts of the API. Clients should present a message to the user, that activation is necessary.

unconfirmedEmail.description: *Optional*. Unconfirmed email address, awaiting confirmation. Will be `null` or undefined, if no email confirmation is pending. See also <<post-user-email-change>>.

activationDate.description: *Optional* The timestamp when the user's account was activated (ISO 8601 format).

termsAcceptedAt.description: *Optional* The timestamp when the user has accepted the terms and conditions (ISO 8601 format).

deviceType.description: Type of devices for which this software is provided/available.

modules.description: Map with (name,version) entries, listing the modules of the software version.

lastName.description: The last name of the member.

firstName.description: The first name of the member.

currentUser.description: `true` if the member is the user that executed the query. May be used to provide additional warning/confirmation messages for destructive operations.

groupAdmin.description: `true` if the member is a group admin.

permissions.description: A list of permissions of the current user for this member. May be `PROMOTE` that allows the member to become group admin, `DEMOTE` that allows an admin to become ordinary member or `REMOVE` that allows removal of the member from the group.

roles.description: A list of user group roles assigned to the member in the context of this group.

email.description: The e-mail address (login) of the member.

redirectUrl.description: *Optional* The redirect URL to the client that initiated this user registration, *optionally* appended with a query parameter that was provided in the prior POST request.

expiry.description: *Optional* ISO Datetime when activation token expires. The issued activation request (i.e. email with activation link) must be answered until then or will become invalid otherwise. Only defined, when `activated=false`.

userId.description: ID of created user (can  not be used on API as long as `activated=false`).

activated.description: Status of user activation. Default is `false`, indicating that there the user must first activate his account. Will return with `true` if the user has been activated directly (e.g. due to some internal rule).

data.description: Contains the parameters of the add operation.

email.description: E-Mail address of the user to add to the group.

transferred.description: Will be `true` if transfer was accepted and could be executed, `false` otherwise.

deviceId.description: Contains the device's new ID if the transfer was accepted and executed. The device's ID will have changed, if a transfer _without data_ was performed. Will be `null` or undefined, if the transfer was canceled.

owner.description: Present if the result is filtered by the `owner` query parameter.

search.description: Present if the result is filtered by the `search` query parameter.

state.description: Present if the result is filtered by the `state` query parameter.

data.description: List of devices. May be empty, if current user's account does not contain any devices or if filter parameters are too restrictive.

filter.description: Applied filter values from request. See <<collection-results>>.

data.description: List of (filtered) software versions. See <<get-software-version>>. May be empty if filter parameters are too restrictive.

owner.description: Reference to the owner of device.

ref.description: The reference to the user or group that owns this device.  May be appended to the Client API path to get a complete URL.

displayName.description: Displayable name of device owner (typically a group or full user name).

entityId.description: The ID of the referenced owner.

email.description: The email address of the referenced owner. Only available if the `type` is `USER`.

addressCountry.description: The country the device is located.

deviceType.description: Device type string as defined in production.

serialNumber.description: MP serial number of a device.

software.description: *Optional* reference to the software version currently installed on the device. This may also be interpreted as the last known 'valid version set' and it changes, if the device reaches a new valid version set (for example after a software update). May be `null` or undefined, if device has never reported its software to the server or if the device runs an unknown software version.

ref.description: The reference to the software version. May be appended to the Client API path to get a complete URL.

displayName.description: Displayable name of the referenced software version.

entityId.description: The ID of the referenced software version.

purpose.description: Purpose is the nature of the device. Value is one of PRODUCT, SAMPLE, DEVELOPMENT

displayName.description: Display name for this device as set by the owner. Defaults to the `serialNumber` if no custom name has been set.

lastSeen.description: Time of device's last contact with the server in ISO-8601 format. May be missing or `null` if device has never been online (with respect to the current data scope).

description.description: Short description or summary of the current health state, may be empty or `null` if status is `OK` or `UNKNOWN`.

state.description: Current health status of device, one of (`OK`, `WARNING`, `ERROR`, `UNKNOWN`).

onlineDays.description: Number of days the device has connected to the cloud at least once. This value documents the connection days during the entire life of the physical device (not only for the current data scope).

runningSoftwareModules.description: *Optional* an object containing the software modules the device reported to have running. This may or may not represent a valid version set. The key of the object is the name of the module. The value is the version of the module. The actual values depend on the type of the device. May be `null` or missing, if device has never reported its software modules to the server.

dataprofile.description: *Optional* reference to the device's current data profile. May be `null` or undefined, if device has never reported a profile to the server.

ref.description: The reference to the dataprofile. May be appended to the Client API path to get a complete URL.

displayName.description: Displayable name of the referenced data profile.

entityId.description: The ID of the referenced dataprofile, e.g. `plM3bbrK/2.4`.

productionDate.description: The date the device was produced.

productionId.description: Identifies a physical device instance (ID given in production).

datapoints.description: Contains latest known values of all datapoints exposed by device, indexed by datapoint ID and is structured like the following example: { "datapointId.01": { "value": 12.34 },  "datapointID.02": ...  }.

timestamp.description: Time (in ISO 8601 format) in which returned state was valid.

remoteControlEnabled.description: Flag to indicate whether this device accepts remote controlling and parametrization through external business applications. In case of `false` the device can only be configured on site.

id.description: Device identifier, identifies data scope of a device. Changes when device is transferred to another owner.

claimingProtectionActive.description: A flag indicating whether or not this device is protected from being claimed.

projectName.description: The name of the project the devices is associated with

addressCity.description: The city the device is located

permissions.description: A list of permissions of the current user for this group. May be `EDIT` that allows editing group properties, or `DELETE` that allows the deletion of the whole group.

displayName.description: The human readable name of the group.

members.description: The total number of members in the group (administrators and/or members).

administrators.description: The number of administrators in the group (at least 1).

api_v3_logs_host_env_type-746189084.example: 2017-08-18 12:21:08.863 DEBUG 10904 --- [main] o.s.b.c.c.ConfigFileApplicationListener  : [] Skipped (empty) config file 'file:./config/cloud-server-config.properties' (file:./config/cloud-server-config.properties) for profile standalone2017-08-18 12:21:24.687  WARN 10904 --- [localhost-startStop-1] o.h.dialect.function.TemplateRenderer    : [] HHH000174: Function template anticipated 4 arguments, but 1 arguments encountered2017-08-18 12:21:33.118  INFO 10904 --- [main] c.b.c.s.services.account.AccountService  : [] Recaptcha service: Using endpoint https://www.google.com/recaptcha/api/2017-08-18 12:21:34.453  INFO 10904 --- [main] c.b.c.s.s.d.importer.DeviceImporter      : [] Importing devices from file 'config\devices\defaultDevices.csv'

data.description: Contains the parameters of the create operation.

name.description: Name of the new group. Maximum 32 characters. Doesn't have to be unique.

subprofileRefs.description: List of subprofile references that are included by this data profile.

datapoints.description: List of datapoints that this dataprofile contains. Only available if queried with `expanded=true`. See <<get-datapoint>> for a more detailed description of the returned datapoint objects.

ref.description: Reference of this dataprofile, format is `id/version`.

subprofiles.description: List of subprofiles that are included by this data profile. Only available if queried with `expanded=true`. The returned subprofile objects are identical to the response objects of <<get-subprofile>> with the exception of the fields defined below.

datapoints.description: IDs of all datapoints that are defined by that subprofile. All of the referenced datapoints will be contained in the `datapoints` list of this data profile.

supportedAspects.description: References to any aspects that are supported by that subprofile. All of the referenced aspects will be contained in the `aspects` list of this data profile.

aspects.description: List of aspects that are required by any of this data profile's implemented subprofiles. Only available if queried with `expanded=true`. See <<get-aspect>> for a more detailed description of the aspect objects.

name.description: Name of this data profile (human readable, typically follows some naming scheme).

state.description: Current state of this data profile (UNPUBLISHED, PUBLISHED or PRODUCTIVE).

aggregatedSupportedAspects.description: List of supported aspects that are aggregated over all subprofiles that are included by this data profile.

properties.description: An optionally empty property-map of `(name:String, value:String)` entries, describing additional properties of this data profile.

data.description: Result data of the pageable request with dataprofile definitions. See <<get-dataprofile>> for a more detailed description of the result object fields.

outgoing.description: Number of pending transfer requests of devices that are scheduled to be transferred to another owner.

incoming.description: Number of pending transfer requests that are scheduled to be transferred from another owner.

totalDevices.description: Total number of devices the user has access to (as owner or by group membership).

problem.description: Number of devices that reported warning or error conditions.

ok.description: Number of devices that reported normal operation.

offline.description: Number of devices that did not connect within the last 5 minutes.

online.description: Number of devices that connected within the last 5 minutes.

mergeable.description: *Optional* flag to indicate that this parametrization request can be merged with another mergeable request in `PENDING` state. Defaults to `false`. Note that parametrizations cannot be mergeable and cancelable at the same time.

datapoints.description: A map of _(datapointId,value)_ entries, where `datapointId` is the ID of a datapoint supported by the device's data profile and `value` is a value that adheres to the datapoint's definition (basetype, format, range, etc).

cancelable.description: *Optional* flag to indicate that this parametrization request is cancelable as long as it is in `PENDING` state. Defaults to `false`. Note that parametrizations cannot be cancelable and mergeable at the same time.

autoCancelAfter.description: *Optional* timestamp in ISO-Format, defining the earliest time when this parametrization may be canceled by the system, if still in `PENDING` state. Must be not be defined if `cancelable=false`.

roles.description: List of this user's roles. May be empty or contain any of `[DEVICE_SUPPORT, USER_SUPPORT, DATA_ANALYST, DEVICE_DEVELOPER, CLIENT_DEVELOPER, INTERNAL_DEVELOPER, CLOUD_MANAGER, USER_ADMIN, SW_ADMIN, METERING_COMMISSIONER_ADMIN, ADMIN, BETA_TESTER]`.

List of all roles: `[DEVICE_SUPPORT, USER_SUPPORT, DATA_ANALYST, DEVICE_DEVELOPER, CLIENT_DEVELOPER, INTERNAL_DEVELOPER, CLOUD_MANAGER, USER_ADMIN, SW_ADMIN, METERING_COMMISSIONER_ADMIN, ADMIN, BETA_TESTER]`.

result.description: *Optional* result of a job in state `SUCCESS`. Actual value depends on type of job. Never defined for any other states.

createdAt.description: Timestamp of the job's creation, as _ISO Datetime String_.

mergeable.description: Indicates whether this job can be merged.

cancelable.description: Indicates whether this job can be canceled.

createdBy.description: Information about the initiator of the job.

ref.description: The reference to the user that created the job.

autoCancelAfter.description: *Optional.* Indicates whether this job will be automatically canceled by the system if it hasn't been executed until the indicated _ISO Datetime String_ timestamp.

confirmedBy.description: Indicates the source of the job's confirmation (or cancellation). Can be one of `USER`, `DEVICE`, `SYSTEM`. Only defined, if request has been canceled or executed/confirmed.

state.description: State of the job. Can be one of `PENDING`, `CANCELED`, `EXECUTING`, `SUCCESS`, `FAILURE`.

id.description: ID of the job. Can be used to cancel the job.

error.description: Error description of a job in state `FAILURE`. Never defined for any other states.

code.description: *Optional* error code. Actual value depends on type of job.

message.description: *Optional* description of the error. Actual value depends on type of job.

confirmedAt.description: Time of the job execution's confirmation (or cancellation), as _ISO Datetime String_. Only defined, if request has been canceled or executed/confirmed.

captchaSolution.description: The solution for the displayed captcha

password.description: The password of the user to delete in plain text.

clientId.description: *Optional* The ID of the client that initiated this user registration.

id.description: ID of the user to delete or the special value `me` to delete the current user.

state.description: *Optional* An additional parameter which is relayed to the client that initiated this user registration. The parameter is added to the redirectUrl as a query parameter, named `state`.

captchaId.description: The id that came with the get request of the captcha. Used to match the solution with the according captcha on the server side.

newsletter.description: If the e-mail newsletter is enabled.

lastName.description: Last name of user. Max 50 characters.

address2.description: *Optional*. Second address line of user. Max 50 characters.

address1.description: *Optional*. First address line of user. Max 50 characters.

locale.description: Locale of current user, used for i18n and l10n. Format is `lang_country`, where `lang` is a ISO 639 alpha-2 or alpha-3 language code and `country` is a ISO 3166 alpha-2 country code. The country part is optional: e.g. `en_US`, `en`, `de_CH`, `de_DE` or `de`.

firstName.description: First name of user. Max 30 characters.

acceptTermsAndConditions.description: By setting the value to `true`, the client of the API guarantees, that the current terms and conditions have been presented to the end user and that he has made an explicit statement that he agrees to those terms (by checking a checkbox, for example). This value must be `true` to use the API.

password.description: The user password (in plaintext). Must have a length of 8-20 chars and contain at least one lowercase letter, one uppercase letter and a digit.

jobFunction.description: Users job function. One of `[PLANNER, CONSULTANT, BUILDING_OPERATOR, INSTALLER, SYSTEM_INTEGRATOR, HVAC_PM, OEM, OTHER]`.

countryCode.description: The ISO alpha-2 country code of the country the user is located at. This has *no* effect on i18n or l10n, but affects business processes. Max 2 characters.

department.description: *Optional*. Work department of user. Max 50 characters.
